haiku:
Green trace climbs the screen
Oscilloscope tracks volts now
Time holds the pulse still

Noise turns to clean plots
data analysis sings
Fit agrees at last

Two slits split the dark
diffraction fans the red beam
Fringes march and fade

Glass splits a thin light
spectroscopy names lines all
Each hue tells atoms

Magnet bites the wire
Hall effect bends charge paths left
Voltage forms a cross

Short waves free them fast
photoelectric effect
Stop volts set the rule

Error bars trail on
error propagation grows
Square, sum, then take root

Check the zero twice
systematics skew the mean
Bias hides in screws

Dots drift like lost bees
curve fitting tames the scatter
Least squares pulls them home

Waves meet and argue
interference makes knots of
Dark bands sip the light

Lamp hums in soft coils
optical pumping sets spins
Atoms drink and flip

Neon glows, then dims
Franck-Hertz shows steps in volts sharp
Quanta wake the gas

Field wraps the old lamp
Zeeman effect splits one line
Spin speaks in twin peaks

Polaroids face off
optical rotation turns
Sugar twists the plane

Mirror cool as ice
reflection returns my beam
Angle in, out, same

One click cuts the dark
quantum optics counts photons
Vacuum makes pairs

Cold puck shuns all drag
superconductor chills, floats
Flux pins the calm ring

No orbit comes back
chaos blooms in driven swings
Order frays to mist

Feedback bites its tail
non-linear system snaps
Small push, wild response

Ink stains the last page
lab report tells what failed too
Graphs earn their calm grade

Leads kiss the bare lead
multimeter beeps, reads ohms
Digits settle, true

Knob turns, current wakes
power supply holds steady
Rails hum, red light on

Sine rolls into square
function generator sings
Duty cycles breathe

Clamps grip the long rail
optical bench keeps things straight
Lenses line up, crisp

Coherent light, tight

Safety goggles save

Square waves march in time
